name: Da House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a short visit to Old San Juan and a stay at Da House. It is a beautifully restored building with fabulous original art through out the building and in the rooms. We stayed in room 407 which has a small patio and access to the balcony. Yes, the rooms are small but they are tastefully furnished and comfortable. The views from the balcony are unbelievable and the little hottub is a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great location !!!!

reviews.text: Yes, it does get noisy at night with the music and the alley but that was half the fun and the salsa music was fun to listen to.
reviews.title: pretty hotel but loud salsa comes through floors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful which we really appreciated.
reviews.title: Trendy, Modern, Clean, Perfectly Located Gem in the heart of San Juan!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are already planning another trip to Old San Juan and Da House!!!!
reviews.title: DA BEST HOTEL IN OLD SAN JUAN

reviews.text: First impressions were very positive.
reviews.title: Checked out after first night

likes.disliked: — The room was below my standards

reviews.text: I stayed at Da House for five days last Fall. Been meaning to write a review for months... I wanted to stay in Old San Juan so I could visit the museums and forts, as well view the beautiful architecture. I called the management about one of their apartment locations. They recommended that I stay at Da House so I decided to take a chance. Glad I did. The location was perfect for daily walks around the city, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms as well as overall hotel were charming. I read a few reviews so initially, I booked a room away from the alley. But after seeing the rooms from the balcony, I switched the next day to a balcony room. The noise didn't bother me a bit (although I guess if you're a light sleeper it might). There wasn't an elevator, but the staff helped me with my bags upon arrival and departure and the walk upstairs wasn't like a skyscraper. The bathrooms were tight, but they were clean and the towels were fresh (something I'm a stickler about). I would give it five stars if it was perfect, but then would it be so affordable?!
reviews.title: Perfect for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Da House for two nights and also with their sister property, La Caleta, for one night in May 2008. We were happy with both properties and would return. We especially loved the location of Da House. Old San Juan has so many great restaurants in the SoFo district which is literally a 5 minute walk from Da House (we recommend Aquaviva and Dragonfly for dinner or drinks). Also, for breakfast there is a great place right around the corner called Mallorca. There are also so many great art galleries close by and we just had such a great time walking around and being centrally located. There is also a great club downstairs called the Nuyorican Cafe that has live music and gives you a taste of the local flavor. The only bad thing is the noise, you will defintiely hear it at Da House.. If you aren't planning to be out late at night, this may be a reason to not stay here. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The decor in Da House is very cool, great artwork and cool furniture but the rooms are small; this is really just a place to stay and don't expect to spend too much time in your room. It is clean and nice but not romantic or luxurious. We also felt very safe at all times, they have great security. On the other hand, you may want to stay at their sister property La Caleta (which you can also book on their website). These are one bedroom apartments that are roomy and also in a great location (right next door to El Convento). The apartments are a little run down but they are roomy, afforable and you can cook some of your meals there and be comfortable. Both of these properties are probably not intended for any high-maintenance travellers that would be happier at a resort in Condado or Isla Verde. If you want to stay in Old San Juan, these properties are the place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in May, 2008. We agree with all the other reviewers on the location - you're almost exactly in the center of the peninsula that's Old San Juan, and so getting anywhere is easy. The rooms were comfortable, though smallish, and the bathroom is rather cramped. Our a/c worked incredibly well, and the staff were fine, though we really didn't need them for anything other than buzzing us in.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The noise was perhaps the only negative; 2 of the 4 nights it was a bit of a problem, though I'm somewhat sensitive to noise. (We were in room 403.) Also, beware that there are no elevators; walking up to the 4th floor doesn't sound like much, but they are tall floors and after a day in the summer heat it felt like a death march!
reviews.title: Very upsetting, stressful experience

likes.disliked: — Staff, service, mold, dead gecko, lack of hot water

reviews.text: Overall though, this was an incredible deal and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel centrally located in the middle of Old San Juan. It was prefect for our stay, there was always something to do regardless of the time of day. Yes, at night the Nuyorican club across the alley is a little loud, but the noise is not unbearable. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the alley, so I’m sure it doesn’t get louder than what we heard. I had no problem sleeping at night. If the noise factor is really an issue to you, pick an interior room.
reviews.title: Great hotel, centrally located
Loooooooved Everything!!!!!!
reviews.text: The restaurant across the alley has delicious lentil soup (I’m not a huge fan of lentil soup). Aside from the Nuyorican at night, there are plenty of spots to mingle at on San Sebastian Street, where you are guaranteed to find salsa music. San Sebastian Street is a couple of blocks away, no more than a five minute walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only bad experience that we had was as a result of one single employee at Da House. Before going further, I would like to add that she was the ONLY rude employee here, everyone else greeted us with a smile and always asked if there was anything they could do for us. This hotel is very safe, in order to get in you have to ring a doorbell and the employees buzz you in. Every single time she was working, and we came back to our room, she questioned if we were staying there and what room we were in, and sometimes even followed us. You would think that after the 4th time, our faces would be recognizable to her. No one else seemed to have a problem with remembering us, but her. She made us feel like we were not important enough.
reviews.title: Chic and cool = Da House

likes.liked: — The art, staff, architecture, and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from that, if you are planning on staying in Old San Juan, this is the place to be. Although this employee in particular was rude, I would stay here again, and just ignore her discourteous manners.
reviews.title: Da House isn't always Da Loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the BEST place to stay in Old San Juan...not only is it so centrally located, but its just got great everything. Clean, beautiful rooms with high ceilings and best of all, gorgeous wood doors that open out onto the street with tiny balconies.
reviews.title: Loved Da House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at da House 2 nights after a cruise. We had originally booked the Milano (and stayed there two nights before the cruise) but much preferred da House.
reviews.title: da House is da Place!

likes.liked: — Clean feeling - tiles and crisp linens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It felt wonderfully clean - no carpets, but tile floors, which were scrubbed once or twice daily. Linens were crisp and clean.
reviews.title: Great choice for old San Juan

reviews.text: The bathroom was small - no counter to place make-up or shaving supplies. We opted for a corner room with two windows and small balconies - lots of light.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay here ......

likes.disliked: — If your on the 3rd/4th floors you'd better be in shape......... lots of stairs.

reviews.text: No problems with noise as others experienced, but we were there Sunday and Monday nights.
reviews.title: Great stay at tucked-away gem in OSJ

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk was extremely helpful with recommendations and taxi arrangements.
reviews.title: If you make a reservation, stick to it.

likes.liked: — The artwork, but I can see great art in places with better service.

description: Located in the heart of Old San Juan, above legendary cafe teatro The Nuyorican Cafe, we offer clean, comfortable, eclectic accommodations in a friendly, vibrant setting that is reminiscent of the character of hostels in great European cities like Amsterdam, Paris or Barcelona. In the 1970s this beautiful four story building in colonial Old San Juan housed the Centro Nacional de las Artes. The Centro was an artist collective that ran an art gallery and workshops.
